poem:
Title: "A Crossed Desert"

On Gaza's scrim, a star-cast tragedy,  
In Congress' halls, a deaf deputee.  
Thousands of miles croon a muffled plea. 
Through hollow words, do we not still see?  

Humanity's whispers cling to the breeze,  
And shores of freedom slowly freeze.  
Yet in the heartland, indifference breeds.  
Action – the most endangered of seeds.
